maybe 'pop culture' and the western view have just perverted the true ninja. And what people assume to be a ninja is nothing more than comic book fantasy....

james wilson <johntwo8@...> wrote:Oh yeah FYI if many of you have ever been to the U.S.A in the last ten years and have dealt with its youth you may know that many will find out about this book and believe whats in it. That is a fact I can not speak for any other place but if you guys really want something to do and I know a few of you have and thats get the word of the truth out there but then again people will belive what they want to believe huh. Hmm so maybe theres no cure at all...

Nate Ledbetter <ltdomer98@...> wrote:
--- ROD PAVEZ <grfkboyz@...> wrote:
Now that you
> mention its a parody I still wonder why anyone would
> waste their time on creating a site that pokes fun
> at the perspective most Americans have of ninja. I
> mean will it change the attitude? Somebody's wasting
> their time I think. 

Probably because they thought it was funny. Just a
thought though.
